original: Majjhima Nikāya 42
analyzed: majjhima nikāya
translated: Middle Length Discourses

original: Verañjakasutta
analyzed: verañjaka sutta
translated: With the Verañjāns

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: Once the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park.

original: Tena kho pana samayena verañjakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā sāvatthiyaṁ paṭivasanti kenacideva karaṇīyena.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena verañjakāḥ brāhmaṇa gahapatikā sāvatthiyam paṭivasanti kenacid eva karaṇīyena
translated: Now at that time the brahmin householders of Verañjā were staying at Sāvatthī for some business or other.

original: Assosuṁ kho verañjakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā:
analyzed: kho verañjakā brāhmaṇa gahapatikā
translated: The brahmin householders of Verañjā heard say:

original: “samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ sakya putto sakya kulā pabbajitaḥ sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: “The ascetic Gotama—a Sakyan son who went forth from a Sakyan family—is staying at Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park.

original: Taṁ kho pana bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ evaṁ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato:
analyzed: tam kha pana bhavantam gotamam evam kalyāṇaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhuggataḥ
translated: And this good report about Master Gotama has spread:

original: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā’.
analyzed: iti pi saḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ vijjā caraṇa sampanno sugataḥ loka vidū anuttaraḥ purisa damma sārathi satthā deva manussānam buddhaḥ bhagavā
translated: ‘Such is he, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a Well-Farer, knower of the cosmos, incomparable leader of persons to be tamed, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, a Buddha, a Blessed Lord.’

original: So imaṁ lokaṁ sadevakaṁ samārakaṁ sabrahmakaṁ sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiṁ pajaṁ sadevamanussaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti.🔽So dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ; kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
analyzed: saḥ imam lokam sa devakam sa mārakam sa brahmakam sa ssamaṇa brāhmaṇim pajam sa deva manussam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti  saḥ dhammam deseti ādi kalyāṇam majjhe kalyāṇam pariyosāna kalyāṇam sa attham sa byañjana kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam pakāseti
translated: He reveals a spiritual life that is utterly perfect & pure.🔽He teaches the Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with the right meaning and phrasing, and he reveals a spiritual life that is utterly perfect & pure.

original: Sādhu kho pana tathārūpānaṁ arahataṁ dassanaṁ hotī”ti.
analyzed: sādhu kho pana tathārūpānam arahatam dassanam hoti iti
translated: It’s a gain for Vesālī, a great gain for Vesālī that the Blessed One—the Tathāgata, arahant, perfectly awakened Buddha—has arrived at Vesālī for the sake of its benefit & welfare.”

original: Atha kho verañjakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā🔽appekacce bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu; appekacce bhagavatā saddhiṁ🔽sammodiṁsu, sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu; appekacce
analyzed: atha khalu verañjakāḥ brāhmaṇa gahapatikāḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā  appekacce bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdisu appekacce bhagavatā saddhi  sammodisu sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdisu appekacce
translated: Then the brahmin householders of Vesālī went to the Blessed One.

original: yena bhagavā tenañjaliṁ paṇāmetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu; appekacce bhagavato santike
analyzed: yena bhagavā tena añjalim paṇāmetvā ekamantam nisīdisu appa ekacce bhagavato santike
translated: On arrival, some of them bowed down to the Blessed One and sat to one side.🔽Some of them exchanged courteous greetings with him and, after an exchange of friendly greetings & courtesies, sat to one side.🔽Some of them sat to one side having saluted him with their hands palm-to-palm over their hearts.🔽Some of them sat to one side without speaking.

original: nāmagottaṁ sāvetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu; appekacce tuṇhībhūtā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu.
analyzed: nāma gottam sāvetvā ekamantam nisīdisu appekacce tuṇhībhūtāḥ ekamantam nisīdisu
translated: and sat down to one side.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinnā kho verañjakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnāḥ khalu verañjakāḥ brāhmaṇa gahapatikāḥ bhagavantam etat avocuḥ
translated: The brahmin householders of Verañjā said to the Blessed One:

original: “ko nu kho, bho gotama, hetu, ko paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjanti?
analyzed: kaḥ nu kho bho gotama hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena midhā ekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjanti
translated: “Master Gotama, what is the cause and reason why some beings here, with the breakup of the body, after death, reappear in a plane of deprivation, a bad destination, a lower realm, hell?

original: Ko pana, bho gotama, hetu, ko paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjantī”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ pana bho gotama hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena midhā ekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjanti iti
translated: What is the cause and reason why some beings here, with the breakup of the body, after death, reappear in a good destination, a heavenly world?”

original: “Adhammacariyāvisamacariyāhetu kho, gahapatayo, evam’idhekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjanti.
analyzed: adhamma cariyā visama cariyā hetu kho gahapatayo evam idha ekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjanti
translated: “Householders, it’s because of unrighteous conduct, conduct not in accordance with the Dhamma, that some beings here, with the breakup of the body, after death, reappear in a plane of deprivation, a bad destination, a lower realm, hell.

original: Dhammacariyāsamacariyāhetu kho, gahapatayo, evam’idhekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjantī”ti.
analyzed: dhamma cariyā sama cariyā hetu kho gahapatayo evam idha ekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjanti iti
translated: It’s because of righteous conduct, conduct in accordance with the Dhamma, that some beings here, with the breakup of the body, after death, reappear in a good destination, a heavenly world.”

original: “Na kho mayaṁ imassa bhoto gotamassa saṅkhittena bhāsitassa, vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa, vitthārena atthaṁ ājānāma.
analyzed: na kho mayam imassa bhoto gotamassa saṅkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena attham a vibhattassa vitthārena attham ājānāma
translated: “We don’t understand in detail the meaning of what was stated in brief by Master Gotama.

original: Sādhu no bhavaṁ gotamo tathā dhammaṁ desetu yathā mayaṁ imassa bhoto gotamassa saṅkhittena bhāsitassa, vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa, vitthārena atthaṁ ājāneyyāmā”ti.
analyzed: sādhu naḥ bhavam gotamaḥ tathā dhammam desetu yathā mayam imassa bhoto gotamassa saṅkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena attham avibhattassa vitthārena attham ājāneyyāma ati
translated: It would be good if Master Gotama would teach us the Dhamma so that we might understand the meaning in detail.”

original: “Tena hi, gahapatayo, suṇātha sādhukaṁ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
analyzed: tena hi gahapatayaḥ suṇātha sādhukam manasi karotha bhāsissāmi iti
translated: “Then listen and attend closely to what I will say.”

original: “Evaṁ, bho”ti kho verañjakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā bhagavato paccassosuṁ.
analyzed: eva bhoti kho verañjakāḥ brāhmaṇa gahapatikāḥ bhagavato paccassosu
translated: “Yes, sir,” the brahmin householders of Verañjā replied.

original: Bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: bhagavān etat avoca
translated: The Buddha said this:

original: “Tividhaṁ kho, gahapatayo, kāyena adhammacārī visamacārī hoti, catubbidhaṁ vācāya adhammacārī visamacārī hoti, tividhaṁ manasā adhammacārī visamacārī hoti.
analyzed: tividham kho gahapatayo kāyena adhamma cārī visama cārī hoti catubbidham vācāya adhamma cārī visama cārī hoti tividham manasā adhamma cārī visama cārī hoti
translated: “Householders, one who engages in non-Dhamma and misconduct by body, speech, and mind in three ways is a person of low life-style.

original: Kathañca, gahapatayo, tividhaṁ kāyena adhammacārī visamacārī hoti?
analyzed: kathañca gahapatayo tividham kāyena adhamma cārī visama cārī hoti
translated: “And how is one a person of low life-style by body in three ways?

original: Idha, gahapatayo, ekacco pāṇātipātī hoti. Luddo lohitapāṇi hatappahate niviṭṭho adayāpanno pāṇabhūtesu.🔽Adinnādāyī kho pana hoti. Yaṁ taṁ parassa paravittūpakaraṇaṁ … taṁ adinnaṁ theyyasaṅkhātaṁ ādātā hoti.
analyzed: idha gahapatayo ekaccaḥ pāṇa atipātī hoti luddaḥ lohita pāṇi hata ppahate niviṭṭhaḥ adaya āpannaḥ pāṇabhūtesu  a dinna ādāyī kho pana hoti yam tam parassa para vittu upakaraṇam tam adinnam theyya saṅkhātam ādātā hoti
translated: There is the case where a certain person is a killer of living beings, bloody-handed, devoted to killing & slaying, showing no mercy to living beings.🔽He is a taker of what is not given. He takes by way of theft the wealth & property of others in the village or in the wilderness as if it were worthless, belonging to someone else.

original: Kāmesumicchācārī kho pana hoti. Yā tā māturakkhitā … tathārūpāsu cārittaṁ āpajjitā hoti.
analyzed: kāmesumicchā cārī kho pana hoti yā tā mātu rakkhitā tathārūpāsu cārittam āpajjitā hoti
translated: He engages in sensual misconduct. He has sexual intercourse with women who are protected by their mother, father, mother & father, brother, sister, or relatives, who have a husband, who are protected by law, or with those who are garlanded in token of betrothal.

original: Evaṁ kho, gahapatayo, tividhaṁ kāyena adhammacārī visamacārī hoti.
analyzed: evam kho gahapatayo tividham kāyena adhamma cārī visama cārī hoti
translated: This is how, householders, one is a person of bad wishes, engaging in bodily, verbal, & mental misconduct.

original: Kathañca, gahapatayo, catubbidhaṁ vācāya adhammacārī visamacārī hoti?
analyzed: kathañca gahapatayo catubbidham vācāya adhamma cārī visama cārī hoti
translated: “And how, householders, is one a person of bad wishes, engaging in misconduct in four ways?

original: Idha, gahapatayo, ekacco musāvādī hoti. Sabhāgato vā … sampajānamusā bhāsitā hoti.🔽Pisuṇavāco kho pana hoti. Ito sutvā amutra akkhātā … vaggakaraṇiṁ vācaṁ bhāsitā hoti.
analyzed: ekaccaḥ musāvādī hoti sabhā gataḥ vā sampajāna musā bhāsitā hoti  pisuṇa vācaḥ kho pana hoti itas sutvā amutra akkhātā vagga karaṇim vācam bhāsitā hoti
translated: There is the case where a certain person is a liar. When he has been called to a town meeting, a group meeting, a gathering of his relatives, his guild, or of the royalty, if he is asked as a witness, ‘Come & tell, good man, what you know’: If he doesn’t know, it’s proper for him to say, ‘I don’t know. ’ If he does know, it’s proper for him to say, ‘I know. ’ If he hasn’t seen, it’s proper for him to say, ‘I haven’t seen. ’ If he has seen, it’s proper for him to say, ‘I have seen. ’ Thus he doesn’t consciously tell a lie for his own sake, for the sake of another, or for the sake of any reward.🔽He is a tale-bearer. Having heard a talk here, he repeats it there in order to divide those people against these. Having heard a talk there, he repeats it here in order to divide these people against those. Thus he is one who divides those who are united and agitates those who are divided.

original: Pharusavāco kho pana hoti. Yā sā vācā aṇḍakā kakkasā … tathārūpiṁ vācaṁ bhāsitā hoti.
analyzed: pharusa vācaḥ kho pana hoti yā sā vācā aṇḍakā kakkasā tathārūpim vācam bhāsitā hoti
translated: He is one who speaks words that are rough, hard to take, offensive to the ear, hurtful to others, cutting them to the quick, disagreeable and unpleasant to other people.

original: Samphappalāpī kho pana hoti. Akālavādī … apariyantavatiṁ anatthasaṁhitaṁ.
analyzed: samphappalāpī kho pana hoti akāla vādī a pariyantavatim anattha sahita
translated: He speaks at the wrong time, speaks what is not fact, speaks what is useless, speaks contrary to the Dhamma and the Discipline;

original: Evaṁ kho, gahapatayo, catubbidhaṁ vācāya adhammacārī visamacārī hoti.
analyzed: evam kho gahapatayo catubbidham vācāya adhamma cārī visama cārī hoti
translated: That is how, in four ways, one is a person of no integrity in what is said.

original: Kathañca, gahapatayo, tividhaṁ manasā adhammacārī visamacārī hoti?
analyzed: kathañca gahapatayo tividham manasā adhamma cārī visama cārī hoti
translated: “And how, householders, is one a person of no integrity in what is thought?

original: Idha, gahapatayo, ekacco abhijjhālu hoti …pe… taṁ mamassā’ti.
analyzed: idha gahapatayo ekaccaḥ abhijjhālu hoti pe tam mamassa ati
translated: Here someone is covetous; he covets the wealth and property of others thus: ‘Oh, may what belongs to another be mine!

original: Byāpannacitto kho pana hoti paduṭṭhamanasaṅkappo: ‘ime sattā haññantu vā … mā vā ahesun’ti.
analyzed: byāpanna cittaḥ kho pana hoti paduṭṭha mana saṅkappaḥ ime sattāḥ haññantu vā mā vā ahesunti
translated: He has ill will and corrupt intention thus: ‘May these beings be slain and slaughtered, may they be cut off, perish, or be annihilated!’

original: Micchādiṭṭhiko kho pana hoti viparītadassano:
analyzed: micchādiṭṭhikaḥ kho pana hoti viparīta dassano
translated: He has wrong view and a distorted perspective thus:

original: ‘natthi dinnaṁ, natthi yiṭṭhaṁ … sacchikatvā pavedentī’ti.
analyzed: na atthi dinna na atthi yiṭṭham sacchikatvā pavedenti iti
translated: ‘There is nothing given, nothing offered, nothing sacrificed. There is no fruit or result of good and bad actions. There is no this world, no next world, no mother, no father, no spontaneously reborn beings; there are in the world no ascetics and brahmins of right conduct and right practice who, having realized this world and the next world for themselves by direct knowledge, make them known to others.’

original: Evaṁ kho, gahapatayo, tividhaṁ manasā adhammacārī visamacārī hoti.
analyzed: evam kho gahapatayo tividham manasā adhamma cārī visama cārī hoti
translated: That is how, in three ways, one is a person of no integrity in what is thought.

original: Evaṁ adhammacariyāvisamacariyāhetu kho, gahapatayo, evam’idhekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjanti.
analyzed: evam adhamma cariyā visama cariyā hetu kho gahapatayo evam idha ekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjanti
translated: It is because of such conduct, such deeds, such behavior, such evil practice that, with the breakup of the body, after death, some beings reappear in a state of deprivation, in an unhappy destination, in perdition, even in hell.

original: Tividhaṁ kho, gahapatayo, kāyena dhammacārī samacārī hoti, catubbidhaṁ vācāya dhammacārī samacārī hoti, tividhaṁ manasā dhammacārī samacārī hoti.
analyzed: tividham kho gahapatayo kāyena dhamma cārī sama cārī hoti catubbidham vācāya dhamma cārī sama cārī hoti tividham manasā dhamma cārī sama cārī hoti
translated: “Householders, a virtuous person, a giver, a benefactor, one who lives the life of brahma-caryā, is one who practices in three ways by body, in four ways by speech, and in three ways by mind.

original: Kathañca, gahapatayo, tividhaṁ kāyena dhammacārī samacārī hoti?
analyzed: kathañca gahapatayo tividham kāyena dhamma cārī sama cārī hoti
translated: “And how, householders, is a virtuous person, a giver, a benefactor, one who lives the life of brahma-caryā, one who practices in three ways by body?

original: Idha, gahapatayo, ekacco pāṇātipātaṁ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti, nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho lajjī dayāpanno sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī viharati.🔽Adinnādānaṁ pahāya adinnādānā paṭivirato hoti, yaṁ taṁ parassa … taṁ nādinnaṁ theyyasaṅkhātaṁ ādātā hoti.
analyzed: idha gahapatayo ekaccaḥ pāṇa atipātam pahāya pāṇa atipātā paṭivirataḥ hoti nihita daṇḍaḥ nihita satthaḥ lajjī dayā āpanno sabba pāṇa bhūta hita anukampī viharati  adinnādānam pahāya adinnādānā paṭivirataḥ hoti yam tam parassa tam na a dinnam theyya saṅkhātam ādātā hoti
translated: Here, a virtuous person, a giver, a benefactor, one who lives the life of brahma-caryā, having abandoned the killing of living beings, abstains from killing living beings; with rod and weapon laid aside, gentle and kindly, he abides compassionate to all living beings.🔽Having abandoned the taking of what is not given, he abstains from taking what is not given; he does not take by way of theft the wealth and property of others in the village or in the forest.

original: Kāmesumicchācāraṁ pahāya … tathārūpāsu na cārittaṁ āpajjitā hoti.
analyzed: kāmesumicchā ācāram pahāya tathārūpāsu na cārittam āpajjitā hoti
translated: Having abandoned unchastity, he observes chastity; he lives secluded from sexual intercourse, abstaining from the vulgar practice of sexual intercourse.

original: Evaṁ kho, gahapatayo, tividhaṁ kāyena dhammacārī samacārī hoti.
analyzed: evam kho gahapatayo tividham kāyena dhamma cārī sama cārī hoti
translated: This is how a virtuous person, a giver, a benefactor, one who lives the life of brahma-caryā, is one who practices in three ways by body.

original: Kathañca, gahapatayo, catubbidhaṁ vācāya dhammacārī samacārī hoti?
analyzed: katham ca gahapatayo catubbidham vācāya dhamma cārī sama cārī hoti
translated: “And how, householders, is a virtuous person, a giver, a benefactor, one who lives the life of brahma-caryā, one who practices in four ways by speech?

original: Idha, gahapatayo, ekacco musāvādaṁ pahāya musāvādā paṭivirato hoti. Sabhāgato vā …pe… na sampajānamusā bhāsitā hoti.🔽Pisuṇaṁ vācaṁ pahāya … samaggakaraṇiṁ vācaṁ bhāsitā hoti.
analyzed: ekaccaḥ musāvādam pahāya musāvādā paṭivirataḥ hoti sabhā gataḥ vā pe na sampajāna musā bhāsitā hoti  pisuṇam vācam pahāya samagga karaṇim vācam bhāsitā hoti
translated: “Here, householders, someone, abandoning false speech, abstains from false speech.🔽Abandoning malicious speech, he abstains from malicious speech.🔽Abandoning harsh speech, he abstains from harsh speech.

original: Pharusaṁ vācaṁ pahāya … tathārūpaṁ vācaṁ bhāsitā hoti.🔽Samphappalāpaṁ pahāya … kālena sāpadesaṁ pariyantavatiṁ atthasaṁhitaṁ.
analyzed: pharusam vācam pahāya tathārūpam vācam bhāsitā hoti  samphappalāpam pahāya kālena sa apadesam pariyantavatim attha sahita
translated: Abandoning gossip, he abstains from gossip.

original: Evaṁ kho, gahapatayo, catubbidhaṁ vācāya dhammacārī samacārī hoti.
analyzed: evam kho gahapatayo catubbidham vācāya dhamma cārī sama cārī hoti
translated: This is how one cultivates and makes much of virtue of speech in four ways.

original: Kathañca, gahapatayo, tividhaṁ manasā dhammacārī samacārī hoti?
analyzed: kathañca gahapatayo tividham manasā dhamma cārī sama cārī hoti
translated: “And how, householders, does one cultivate and make much of virtue of mind in three ways?

original: Idha, gahapatayo, ekacco anabhijjhālu hoti. Yaṁ taṁ parassa paravittūpakaraṇaṁ taṁ nābhijjhātā hoti: ‘aho vata yaṁ parassa, taṁ mamassā’ti.
analyzed: idha gahapatayo ekaccaḥ an abhijjhālu hoti yam tam parassa para vittu upakaraṇam tam na abhijjhātā hoti aho vata yam parassa tam mamassa ati
translated: “Here, householders, someone is not covetous. He does not covet the wealth and property of others thus: ‘Oh, may what belongs to another be mine!

original: Abyāpannacitto kho pana hoti appaduṭṭhamanasaṅkappo: ‘ime sattā averā abyābajjhā anīghā sukhī attānaṁ pariharantū’ti.
analyzed: a byāpanna cittaḥ kho pana hoti appaduṭṭha mana saṅkappaḥ ime sattāḥ averāḥ a byābajjhāḥ anīghāḥ sukhī attānam pariharantu uti
translated: He has a mind of loving-kindness without inner hate, ill will, or affliction.
